snippet: Even as United Nations negotiators expressed optimism that they may finally achieve a deal, experts cautioned that it probably would not stave off global warming’s near-term impact.
abstract: Thousands of diplomats gather in Lima, Peru, for United Nations summit meeting to draft agreement intended to stop global rise of planet-warming greenhouse gases; negotiators express new optimism about prospect of deal following decades of struggle, but tone is offset by grim scientific outlook; policy experts warn that it may now be impossible to prevent rise in temperature.
lead_paragraph: Even as United Nations negotiators expressed optimism that they may finally achieve a deal, experts cautioned that it probably would not stave off global warming’s near-term impact.

headline.main: Optimism Faces Grave Realities at Climate Talks
headline.print_headline: Optimism Faces Grave Realities at Climate Talks
